meaningMnemonic: 握り is a "grip." When you add お it's elevated a bit. For some reason it becomes a <vocabulary>rice ball</vocabulary> (aka <vocabulary>onigiri</vocabulary>). To make a rice ball, you use your grip to make them into a ball shape, which is probably where it comes from.
readingMnemonic:
The reading comes from 握り.

Note that this is usually written in hiragana as おにぎり.
